newsitem.title: CHINA: Hughes unit launches first China venture.
newsitem.headline: Hughes unit launches first China venture.

text.p: Delco Electronics on Thursday announced its first joint venture in China to make automotive parts and instruments, partly for use by a planned General Motors carmaking venture in Shanghai.

Shanghai Delco Electronics and Instrumentation Co would involve an investment of $30 million, half by Delco and half by Shanghai Chang Jiang Instrument Factory, company director William Spelman told a news conference.

The venture, on Chongming island in the Yangtze River estuary north of Shanghai, will manufacture mechanical, electro-mechanical and electronics instruments and parts for automobiles, motorcycles, tractors and trucks, he said.
Delco is a subsidiary of GM Hughes Electronics Corp.
The Chinese partner, Chang Jiang Instrument Factory, had sales of 165 million yuan in 1995, making it China's biggest company in this field, Spelman said.
He said the venture planned to gradually expand sales, mainly to the Chinese market, including a planned GM joint venture in the Pudong New Area of Shanghai.
Delco would be a long-term player in the China market and was discussing other mainland joint ventures, Spelman said.

Delco Electronics posted $5.6 billion in sales of electronics and instrumentation products in 1995, ranking it as one of the world's top auto parts companies and number one in automotive electronics, a Delco statement said.
